metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34471 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When downloading an update for an addon, the downloaded addon update's version was not verified to match the version selected from the manifest. If the manifest had been tampered with on the server, an attacker could trick the browser into downgrading the addon to a prior version. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34471` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
